reviewText: If you have ever wanted to see the beautiful model Angie Everhart get 100% naked and also get down and dirty in bed then this is the movie for you.Because Ms. Everhart is such a well known model i did not expect her to have any hot or kinky sex scenes in this movie and i realy didn't expect her to show full frontal nudity but thank goodness i was wrong.This movie is about a man(Richard Grieco)who kills one of his lovers in bed by accident while chocking her,he is found guilty of involuntary manslughter and is given probation.It turns out that the officer keeping track of Grieco(Angie Everhart)was also a close friend of the girl he killed.What a small world!Angie must do whatever it takes to prove that Grieco is a Sexual Predator and while keeping track of him she finds herself in dark kinky sex clubs and also finds she is attracted to him.Angie Everhart sizzles in this erotic thriller,during her sex scenes she shows every inch of her beautiful body and leaves pretty much nothing to the imagination.The very first time you see Angie in a sex scene will take your breath away as she is the one on top and you can see 100% of her naked body.The plot of this movie gets very dark at times and Richard Grieco plays the part of a pervert perfectly.Angie has plenty of sex in this thing and even when things are not steamy you are kept glued to the screen because of a solid plot.This movie has a great "twist" ending too that you might be kind of confused about if you dont watch the whole thing through.As always,make sure you get the UNRATED version of this movie because the R-rated version has all the sex taken out.ALWAYS GET UNRATED!

reviewText: when wathcing a movie like this you must keep in mind it is not emmy material.  it is a bad movie.  do not expect much. i love movies like this.  i see such harsh reviews from some people.  what were you expecting?  life altering movie?this is the story of J.C. Gale,(played by Richard Grieco) a photographer who is accused of involuntary manslaughter for the quite accidental strangling of a lover during sex.  he is given probation and Beth Spinella, played by Angie Everhart, is to monitor his "rehabilatation"what follows is a story of sex, manipulation, power struggles and some of the hottest sex scenes to hit the screen.  Angie blurs the line between pleasure and pain and Richard Grieco, i thought, was seductive and evil.  you never knew if he was truly a sexual preadator or just guilty of accidental erotic sex which resulted in murder.  his quiet whisperings lured Beth into his bed at the risk of her job.  i think this movie is worth viewing for the sex alone.  also, the ending was quite surprising.  nice touch.i would never expect anything more from this movie than a quasi-interesting plot.  it was ok.  not great.  not bad.  simply ok,  i have seen alot worse.

reviewText: Former model Angie Everhart has found a second career making B movies & I think that's terrific!  This one is by far & away the best one of her movies I've seen.  I actually found it to be WAY better than the rather energylessAnother 9 1/2 Weeks.The storyline is in the same vein asBasic Instinct - Director's Cut (Ultimate Edition), only with some twists.  Richard Grieco plays a fellow who accidentally killed a lady during kinky sex games.  Or was it an accident?  Therein lies the question.  Grieco seemed to be an up & coming actor in the early-to-mid 1990s before his career seemed to fizzle out.  Was good to see him again.Angie plays the dude's parole officer {the guy is given parole when a jury determines that the girl's death was an accident}.  Of course, Angie has other reasons for taking his case which cause a professional conflict-of-interest.Of all of Angie's films that are in my collection, this one scores the highest on the skin-o-meter.  While she normally doesn't shy away from shedding her clothes, other movies (like Another 9 & 1/2 Wks) have used bad camera angles during her steamy scenes.  Not so this one!  If you want some great shots of Angie topless, THIS is the flick to get!If you're a fan of Angie Everhart, this DVD belongs in your collection.  Ditto for people who (like me!) think that Hollywood could use more sensual redhead actresses.  I personally think that Angie is the hottest redhead since Tawny Kitean was in her prime.

reviewText: The world of erotic thrillers is a very interesting one indeed, and it is moviemaking like no other.It seems that there are two or three templates that all directors religiously follow, be it the plot, or the sex scenes (their number, variations and style).As the cliche goes, watch one erotic thriller and you watch them all, but as we all know this is not the case, for no matter how lame or repetitive the formula is, it is a huge  hundreds of million dollars market that is specifically aimed at people who do not watch hardcore (or pretend not to) but who at the same time want a bit of sauce with the excitement of a thriller.In all erotic thrillers you will always find the following,1-There is always a psycho male or female, either bent on revenge for some misdeed that happened when they were too young to remember, or an obsessive person who either likes to watch people getting it on ,or is  scheming to get richer and richer and has no qualms about  sleeping with lots of people (before killing them that is) to achieve his/her goal.2-The man is usually a high flying businessman, played almost always by an actor who looks more like a freelance stripper than a dealmaker, while the woman is 6 feet tall, with looks, body and health  that would suggest catwalk rather than taking care of the little offsprings.3-Most women who play the lead in erotic thrillers are indeed either veterans of the catwalks..(Probably thinking it is a good move into Hollywood that might one day lead to Oscars rehearsals,Angie Everhart,Amber Smith,Joan Severance...),or graduates of the soft core/magazine industry (Jacqueline Lovell, The Tweeds,Julie Strain....)4-The plot is usually so lame and predictable, invariably the fast forward function is never used as much as for these films.Yet it is a good excuse to watch them, exactly like claiming to buy Playboy for the interviews and articles, a story in erotic thrillers can be an excuse for watching the numerous sex scenes.The acting is mostly from the 'overacting that flows from your ears' school of acting, while the directors have usually an ego the size of Texas (a film by so and so is usually the first to appear on the credits) without the talent to match .5-The sex scenes all look the same no matter how many films you watch, as if all erotic thriller directors have a sort of agreement between themselves to shun any originality.The same pans,close ups,cuts,positions, and camembert tunes, with the ubiquitious girl-girl scene.It always amazes me how people in erotic thrillers and at the very first touch are consumed by an incredible passion and unbearable ecstacy,and it makes me wonder what did they have for dinner? (whatever it is , I am  ordering some right now!), but since the 'action' only lasts for ten or fifteen seconds at most, I will think twice before  ordering anything.So, Sexual Predator has all these elements, and of course it also has the incredibly gorgeous and sexy Angie Everhart who is a delight to watch, with or without her clothes,and is worth buying this DVD for.If you are a fan of erotic thrillers, then Sexual Predator will not certainly not disappoint, providing lame acting, but beautiful women.
summary: An Erotic Thriller Like.. All Others!

reviewText: At what point, does bad filmmaking become criminal?  Wherever that line is, it was surely crossed with Sexual Predator, the film industry's equivalent to a lanced boil.  This "film" pairs Richard Grieco and Angie Everhart both doing their best to live up to the dynamic duo of Shannon Tweed and Andrew Stevens and both failing miserably.  The plot revolves around a probation officer (The Swimsuit Model) and one of her assigned offenders (The 21 Jumpstreeter).  It tackles such moral quandaries as; Should a sexually traumatized person be in charge of the parole of a man who killed their best friend through severe sexual trauma?  Tough philosophical questions like these abound in the "film" directed by Robert Angelo.  Frankly it's surprising that the "film" has credits at all.  One can only speculate blackmail or some equally heinous maneuver led those participating to attach their names to this debacle.  The "film" is of course directed at the 14-17 year-old male audience with access to Cinemax.  The "film" though, fails to titillate although extremely stupid members of the target audience might be able to disengage from the horror that is the rest of the film and focus on only the sex scenes.  I detracted one star each for the acting, directing, production, script, sound, cinematography, makeup, score and casting.  I gave back five stars either; hoping that the starring freckled beauty would go on a date with me, or because Amazon does not allow for reviews lower than 1 star. I recommend 4-7 years in Marion for all key members of the "film"making team.
summary: Not as bad as Matrix: Revolutions, but close
